alert.note: Alert for Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 10:31AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Latham Park affecting Winnebago County. .River gauge data and ice spotter reports suggest an ice jam is located near Machesney Park. With continued cold weather over the next few days, the ice jam is likely to remain in place or only gradually shift downstream. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...Rock River at Latham Park. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Boathouses threatened along the river in Machesney Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to as much as 8.9 feet by this afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late tonight.
